issues.title: Data Model
issues.author: mnot
issues.body:
Right now the data model is JSON-based, which allows arbitrary depth and is not terribly good in HTTP fields and other places like HTML attributes.

We could subset JSON like Structured Fields does, or we could adopt the SF type system (or a subset of it).

issues.title: Link hint to indicate a resource class
issues.author: mnot

comments.author: mnot
comments.body: This seems speculative; all of the other defined hints are 'paving cowpaths'. Rather than doing it in this spec -- which would require defining what it means in detail, rather than just copying a pattern used elsewhere -- I'd suggest closing this issue and if there's interest, registering the hint in a standalone spec.

comments.body: We're moving to a simpler data model for link hints in #1 so I think this is overcome by events -- you'd put the profile in the media type string.

issues.title: Link Hints Registry
issues.author: mnot
issues.body: Some thought needs to go into the registry, since registered values are effectively used for ALL link hints in all serialisations that opt into it.
